licome&slong; lu&slong;t, þurh þe fal&slong;e feond,
leadeð þe toward fle&slong;chliche fulðe, on&slong;were
i þi þoht tus: `Ne Geineð þe nawt, &slong;weoke!
þullich ichulle beon i meidenes liflade, Ilich heuene engel.
Ichulle halde me hal, þurh þe grace of godd, a&slong;
cunde me makede, þat parai&slong;e &slong;elhðe underfo me,
all &slong;wuch a&slong; weren, ear ha Gulten, his ear&slong;te
heamen.  Allunge, &slong;wuch ichulle beon as i&slong; mi deore
leofmon, mi derewurðe lauerd, & as i&slong; tat eadi meiden
þat he him chea&slong; to moder.  Al &slong;wuch ichulle wite
me, treoweliche unwemmet, a&slong; ich am him iweddet. ne nul ich
nawt, for a lu&slong;t of a lute hwile, þah hit þunche
delit, awai warpe þat þing, hwas lure ichulle biremen
wiðute couerunge, & wið eche brune abuggen in helle. þu
wrech-wile-ful wiht!  al for nawt þu proke&slong;t me to
forgulten, & forgan þe bli&slong;&slong;e up-o
bli&slong;&slong;e, þe crune up-o crune of meidene&slong; mede;
& willes & waldes warpe me as wrecche i þi leirwite; And,
for þat englene &slong;ong of meidenhades men&slong;ke, wið
þe & wið þine greden ai & granen i þe eche
grure of helle.' &YOGH;if þu þus on&slong;weres to þi licomes
lu&slong;t & to þe feondes fondinge, he &slong;chal fleo
þe wið &slong;chome.  And &yogh;if he alles after þis,
inoh raðe, at&slong;tonde & halt on to eili þi
fle&slong;ch & prokie þin herte, þi lauerd godd hit
þoleð him to muccli þi mede; for, as &slong;ente pawel
&slong;eið, `ne beð nan icrunet, bute hwa&slong;e treoweliche
i þulli feht fihte, & wið &slong;trong cockunge ouercume
hire fle&slong;ch'; for þenne i&slong; te deouel, wið
hi&slong; ahne turn, &slong;chomeliche awarpen.  Hwen þu,
a&slong; te apo&slong;tle &slong;eið, ne &slong;chalt beon
icrunet, bute þu beo a&slong;ail&yogh;et; for [&yogh;if] godd wile cruni þe, he wile leote ful wel þe unwiht
a&slong;ail&yogh;e þe, þat tu earni þer-þurh,
crune upo crune. for-þi hit i&slong; þe mea&slong;t god,
þat, hwen he greueð þe mea&slong;t, & toward
þe wið fondinge wodeluker weorreð, &yogh;if þu wel
hile&slong; te under godes wenge&slong;; for, þurh
þi&slong; weorre, he &yogh;arkeð þe, unþonc
hi&slong;e teð, þe bli&slong;&slong;e & te crune of
cri&slong;tes icorene.  And ihesu cri&slong;t leue þe,
þurh his ble&slong;cede nome, & alle þeo þat
leauen luue of lami mon, for to beon his leofmon ; & leue
&slong;wa hare heorte halden to him, þat hare fle&slong;ches
eggunge, ne þe feondes fondunge, ne nan of his eorðliche
limen, ne weorri hare heorte wit, ne wrenche ham ut of þe wei
þat ha beoð in gongen; And helpe ham &slong;wa in him to
hihen toward heuene, a ðat ha beon i&slong;tihe þider,
a&slong; hare brudlac &slong;chal, in al þat eauer &slong;el
i&slong;, wið þene &slong;eli brudgume þat
&slong;iheð alle &slong;elhðe of, &slong;itten buten ende!
AMEN!
